message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the analysis of polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting codes used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the tradeoff among block length, code rate, and error probability, which is a topic related to coding theory and complexity theory, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also mentions the analysis of general codes over general channels, which could fall under cs.SI (Systems and Control) or cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
